page.title: 06Tilshead's Anglican Church
page.content: The church of St.Thomas a' Becket, Tilshead is very old. It was built in the 10th Century or even earlier. There are three cast bells in the square stone tower. These were put there in the 18th Century but they are not rung nowadays. The outside walls have been built with the local flint stone. The pretty stained-glass windows were designed by the reverend J.H.Johnson. The church organ is old and rare. It was put in the church in 1906. We enjoy visiting our church and have produced many plays and concerts in the simple and sacred surroundings. There is a story that the lock on the font is to keep away witches and their spells from the holy water. We have lots of christenings, weddings and funerals in our church. It is a centre of our village life. It is mentioned in the Domesday Book 1085.
